alert.note: Alert for Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 22 at 4:26PM MDT by NWS Riverton
info.description: ...A BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL AFFECT PARTS OF GREEN MOUNTAINS AND RATTLESNAKE RANGE...CASPER MOUNTAIN...AND NATRONA COUNTY LOWER ELEVATIONS... HAZARDS...A band of heavy snow accompanied by winds of 20 MPH which can rapidly reduce visibility briefly reduce visibility to a quarter mile. LOCATION AND MOVEMENT...At 423 PM MDT, a band of heavy snow was 8 miles north of Alcova, or 24 miles southwest of Casper moving northeast at 55 MPH. This activity could produce a quick inch of snow, and localized 2 inches. The heavy snow will last around 1 hour. THIS BAND OF HEAVY SNOW WILL BE NEAR... Emigrant Gap around 440 PM MDT. Red Butte and Paradise Valley around 445 PM MDT. Casper around 450 PM MDT. Antelope Hills around 500 PM MDT. This includes Interstate 25 between mile markers 176 and 220. SAFETY INFO... Use extra caution if you must travel into or through this band of heavy snow. Rapid changes in visibility and potentially slick roads may lead to accidents. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. &&

area.areaDesc: Casper Mountain; Green Mountains and Rattlesnake Range; Natrona County Lower Elevations
